channel.title: Buzzing on Quora
channel.description: 用中文浏览Quora上的热门回答

item.title: What is the "dinosaur size gap"? Tomaž Vargazon explains: https://t.co/OcTGiIwZ9P https://t.co/oDoMzZnX86
This is a cool trick? What #lifehacks have you learned on Quora? https://t.co/46Hxd0m5mS

What problems are businesses facing when it comes to understanding their data? CEO & Founder of @sisudata Peter Bailis (@pbailis) shares his professional insights. https://t.co/J0Q1lZPGD5 https://t.co/wxeJkf1v6x

How many of you learned that North America was populated by early human crossing a land bridge from Siberia to Alaska? Colleen Anne Coyle describes some recent #archaeology findings that suggest people came by sea, not by land, and MUCH earlier! https://t.co/rl4N4uI81l

What does the phrase “majority minority” refer to, and when will the United States population reach this milestone? Associate Professor of Policy and Government @GeorgeMasonU @ScharSchool Immigration / Demographic Change, @_JustinGest explains. https://t.co/KlTyGvoEPJ https://t.co/DbRuFX6ZKa

Five directors were nominated for an Academy Award this year. Want to know how they got their films in theaters? Clayton Brown, documentary film maker and professor @NorthwesternU, shares how it's done. https://t.co/d4VaygerOo https://t.co/eh5VUuIq9n
What do philosophers think about Jordan Peterson? @fmdolan gives us some insight: https://t.co/NnqROyOVFe
What is early application and how can I use it to my advantage? CEO, Crimson Education, @JamieBeaton_nz, breaks it down: https://t.co/2VEMeieYiS https://t.co/O7XzbHcfmT
Who's #hiking this weekend? Has anyone done part of the Pacific Coast Trail? Barbara has and shares some valuable insights: https://t.co/SsnPaUhkTe

President & CEO of @sffed (San Francisco Federal Reserve), @MaryDalyEcon answers the questions everyone wants to know: Will the labor market improve in 2022? And why are so many job openings not getting filled? https://t.co/SKoe6wLRTt https://t.co/QdZXKWW5EW

Did you know that King Nebuchadnezzar II, famous for the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, built an enormous labyrinth around his palace that still exists today? Silvia Serra shares the story in the Wonders of the Past Space: https://t.co/lfvP23Dhmf https://t.co/RGhBj4CVo5
Why is a green screen green and not some other color? Clayton Brown explains the science behind it: https://t.co/3OMnkGY5iq
Have you ever seen a firetruck with an oddly-specific notice to stay back 343 feet? Firefighter David Wayne explains why: https://t.co/xC1bTk2ljv

How can you use statistics to increase your changes of school admissions? CEO, Crimson Education, @JamieBeaton_nz, explains two crucial ways you can use numbers to your advantage. https://t.co/kaIeT062GS https://t.co/Tgea5HWhpu
Did Harriet Tubman have an adopted daughter? Here's what historians think: https://t.co/HXKvOlyXjE https://t.co/2rJf7eewBf

At Quora, we talk a lot about sharing knowledge, but what do we mean by that? When you think of knowledge, you may first think about one specific kind - knowing facts about the world. This is referred to in @vervaeke_john's lectures as perspectival knowing, but there are others!

Everyone knows about Martin Luther King, but do you know about Fred Hampton's contributions to civil rights? Read about it in this answer from Robert Strickland in the Black History Space: https://t.co/Q0nRCQxpwm https://t.co/wtQq52GTsP

Oscar nominations were announced today. Interested in the art of film making? We'll be sharing answers over awards season that might interest you. Let's start with @NorthwesternU professor, Clayton Brown, explaining why green screens are green: https://t.co/3OMnkGGuqS

Did you know that Queen Amidala from Star Wars: The Phantom Menace was based on a real person? Tomas Hernandez tells the heart-breaking story of what happened to her: https://t.co/YcPFyWDKzo https://t.co/hH7GWXMH3k

Will CEO Elizabeth Holmes face jail time for the Theranos scandal? Former federal prosecutor and founder of @WestCoastTrial, Neama Rahmani, shares his insights: https://t.co/Zc1fFW6v85 https://t.co/xBVMjfdrgA
How many megapixels would our eyes be? Steve Baker explains how our eyes are not at all like a digital camera: https://t.co/qUugBnRTV4 https://t.co/GzyvflXZ0E
Did you know that Arthur, as in King Arthur, was just a nickname? Claire Jordan, folklore expert, tells us about the real King Arthur https://t.co/2VbxMOXpGk https://t.co/itUAgoOf8m
Who's working on their novel this weekend? Quora writer @mercedeslackey gives the perfect demonstration of Goodhart's law applied to the bestseller category: https://t.co/VaJWksTMWv
What would you like to see us discuss? https://t.co/dBMh5qfTo9
What type of plastic surgery would a plastic surgeon tell you not to get? Find out from plastic surgeon R. Laurence Berkowitz, MD: https://t.co/wIIeaVXarI https://t.co/NvtK89bUjt
What is up with the Finnish language? Steven Haddock explains: https://t.co/m2Nn3kSsFw

How can technology help co-parents navigate their separate lives? Dr. Marsha Kline Pruett, professor, psychologist, researcher, and advisor to @OurFamilyWizard, explains how to use the tools you have for parenting success. https://t.co/ZS80I1ZVTY https://t.co/MhaaFVTTZI
Ever wonder what a Congressional Representative does? Ask Congressman @ericswalwell! He represents the 15th district in California. https://t.co/T6mrZrqSDo

Here on Twitter, due to @elonmusk's larger-than-life influence, it's hard to find level-headed discussion of #Tesla's pros and cons. Not so on Quora, as in this excellent discussion from long-term Tesla owner Christian Bull: https://t.co/7LRYF7aiFQ What are your pros & cons? https://t.co/SqCDKbqIzf
What is the best way to remember things? Corey Fradin, founder of QuickBooost, shares his best tips. https://t.co/E1ubTYueej https://t.co/MaQBCx2VGu

How has the coronavirus affected the life of startups and entrepreneurs? @YehongZhu, founder of @ZetteMedia, details how COVID affected her business plans in 2020. https://t.co/cMXuWYf1Mv https://t.co/xflI1IaDHf

Dealing with co-parenting issues? Doctor Marsha Kline Pruett, Professor, Psychologist, Researcher, and Advisor to @OurFamilyWizard, shares 5 techniques for handling contentious situations. https://t.co/aOHElGlYJH https://t.co/BKQBHdOQ2z
What are some big shifts we’ll see with the Gig economy in 2022? @JordanPeace, CEO of Fringe, predicts the trends. https://t.co/AUf1vRf4an https://t.co/WEbwRnUjYv

So you're reading an answer on Quora and you don't know if it's any good. How do you tell? Upvotes are available, but they say more about popularity than the degree to which acting on the answer will achieve your goals. Comments have the same problem as the answer. THREAD!

What are some other countries where home cooking is considered best or where restaurant/street food is best, and what are some other characteristics of that culture that might correlate? Communal vs individualistic, maybe? https://t.co/UL66C3PU9t
Ever heard of Ataloia fever? Dr. Jo tells the story of all the unknown viruses that haven't yet made the headlines: https://t.co/xZk5Hs9yB5 https://t.co/Ys4T5uUJvx
Who remembers Kodak in their glory days? Paul Tomblin was there for the fall and tells us the story: https://t.co/7w9Urgtqd6 https://t.co/17UNfZtxjP
Where are the new hotspots for tech jobs? In the remote work world, they're different! https://t.co/S8ADFKH3qm

Considering moving your business's data to the cloud? Here are four factors to consider. @qumulo's Vice President of Product Management, Ben Gitenstein, explains. https://t.co/U7aZbsHAmJ https://t.co/GlJneXvJFL
What are some tips for getting financial aid? Admissions expert and CEO of @moon_prep, Kristen Moon, shares 5 easy steps. https://t.co/gatkLY6jLK https://t.co/9NhcFm3dvk
Who loves Beijing snacks? Fei-fei Wang does! https://t.co/YnlAPAhfVa https://t.co/6apb1M6x7N
Ever wonder why Windows systems use CR+LF while Linux only uses LF? Michael Lush has the deets: https://t.co/iWURJnecZk https://t.co/rfEBPUoKtV
Fun challenges and cash prizes, what more could you want? https://t.co/G5Y5bIiT0G
Hey @CarCaster, relevant to your interests? https://t.co/OqfgG65eKn
What's it like to live in a little village in Turkey? Let Gizem Acar, who lives in a picturesque such village, tell you about it: https://t.co/TuJCB2SkcK https://t.co/vGHXrtuWgJ

Nano-chameleons, zombie frogs, and shrieking hyrax. Gary Meaney tells us all about the cool new critters that were discovered in 2021. What do you think we'll discover in 2022? https://t.co/ptbmUYiP2Y https://t.co/ilUhKteypn
What do you remember most about Sidney Poitier? What was his best performance? https://t.co/FHp2AYXRFd https://t.co/twyTA06eDU
Would you believe that Saudi Arabia imports sand? Piotr Marciniak explains: https://t.co/RV4pbZaFM9 https://t.co/vs5lGPSUKE

Do you enjoy solving math and computer science puzzles? Would you like to try your hand at some user-tested puzzles derived from real-world challenges? Then you'll probably like the Quora Programming Challenge. https://t.co/yZxotfs7pJ p.s. There are cash prizes.
